page.title: 18HOUSING IN SALISBURY
page.content: City centre town housing 13-19 century many listed buildings. Outside central area Victorian terraced housing mainly brick and slate. On outskirts housing estates built in 80's;semi-detached or detached;often pebble-dash and tile. Post war development includes Local Authority estates with some low-rise flats. Planning policy limits height of buildings in Salisbury. Recent building consists of sheltered housing for the elderly, homes for first-time buyers or luxury housing. Over half of all homes are privately owned. Salisbury is popular as communications are good-not far from coast-no heavy industry-surrounded by beautiful countryside ;prices therefore high - Modernised terrace - Â£35,000 Three-bedroomed semi - Â£45,000 Four bedroomed detached - Â£70,000 Sheltered housing from - Â£30,000
